Ok. So i know there is a long awaited update about to be released for this game but i want to get this off my chest. #1 When painting with the roller, if you accidentally click on a piece that you don't want to paint you should be able to cancel the painting prompt rather then having to paint said piece a wrong color and then paint it again because there is no way to cancel. #2 The automatic car wash is broken, it works most times but..there have been quite a few instances where i would get stuck in the first portion of the wash and have to close the wash and then reopen for it to even do the animation and still wont complete the cycle. #3 I cant have more then one employee cleaning the station because they both battle each other for the same footprints on the floor and for the same garbage on the floor and nothing more gets achieved as a result, as of right now the only thing i can have more then one employee doing is pumping gas. #4 You should be able to place shelves and other like items on the floor and have it be perfectly aligned with the grid, all my stuff is mismatched because the game itself will NOT let me place items straight. (It's really annoying) #5 All my plants for decoration shrink in size every time i log off and back in again, it only fixes when i pick up the plant which turns it back to full size and then have to place it again. #6 The graphics constantly skew on me meaning people walking will have their feet stretched out or there head and things don't render properly being that vehicles pulling up to the station will have no rims on the vehicle (i'm only playing on medium graphics). #7 The optimization for this game is terrible, (for me anyway but running on a 1070 GTX) 40 + hours in and i'm yet to get decent frames. Other then that, really great game, super addicting and just flat out great to have fun with. Those are the main things i have issues with playing this game daily. The early days prologue ran better then the full version. If most of this gets fixed with the up coming update then that will be fantastic but until then i have a hard time playing the game at the level i'm at because of all the bugs and glitches and non rendering and the game just not recognizing that something that should be working is in fact not working. That's my rant and i am outta here.

A good slack off game. Ultimately I really enjoy MOST of what it provides in terms of the escalating "pressure" of a successful business.

There isn't some story to write out my dissertation and vent out lamentations over my failure at professional writing, so instead here are some pros & cons

[h1]Pros[/h1]

+ Looks nice (non-human things anyway)
+ Simple at first, lots of depth later
+ Mechanically concise and fun
+ + + Filling gas was reliably fun
+ Really have no issue with how your store grows
+ - - Notable exception to this; I really hate sandstorms. They're just frustrating and not fun to me
+ Gives a solid 15-20 hours of guaranteed content depending on how quickly you adapt
+ + + And obviously if you want to devote more time you can, just you will have NEW things in this span

[h1]Cons[/h1]

- Relatively low ceiling, I wanted heavier rushes, more complex problems, etc.
- - - No reason to expand shelving. I wanted refrigerated walls etc. My favorite part of working a gas station
- - - Additionally, modernity in general is lacking. I get it would be difficult but...
- Seems to have memory leaks, went from 200+ fps maxed to stuttering 40 fps toward the end of my 15 hours
- If you know how to mod, New Vegas crashes less than this.
- Employees need a lot of work
- - - Employees get stuck OFTEN and require firing to reset
- - - Employees are severely limited, let me tell them to work the car wash, promote one to be keyholder and tell others to go on break, make it really something interesting
- - - I feel there are many more ideas for employees off the table here; laziness meter, hustle, yada yada.

[h1]Ambivalents[/h1]

o Humans look rough but they grow on you
o Cashiering is a grab bag of "That was really fun" vs. "The game fucked me"
o Dennis is just annoying and really doesn't serve a purpose that I could tell

-----------------

I have my issues but all of them would give me more reason to play this MORE. I had and have no issue recommending it for full price having stopped where I stopped. If this game was $60 the devs would be dead to me, but they know what they have here. I look forward to their expanded efforts, and hope this can be one of those games I comfortably sink 300 hours into. As of now, it isn't the case.

I had a lot of fun with this game for the first eight hours of play. Like, i can't stress how much fun i was having. I had not found a game i liked this much in a while. I figured this would be a game i could sink a few hundred hours into. Then on my third day of playing the game, it just wouldn't work anymore. I tried restarting the game, then my computer, then i tried reinstalling the game, then i tried any trick online that had even the smallest chance of working. I've tried everything i could think of and nothing works. My only regret is playing this game for more than eight hours so I can't return it.
The game is fun to play but seems to have some glitches. i've had re start the game a few times to get things to work.

13 Hours at the time of review. This game is fun hence the thumbs up my very first run through I am attempting to run 24/7 service which keeps me very busy all the time almost to a point of stressing out. As is expected trying to run a full service station 24/7 and solo. Hiring employees helped a bunch, but then there was more stuff to do. I still feel far from the end of the game, and its becoming frustrating level up goals seem to increase exponentially for no real reason other than to prolong the game. With a larger station it seems my game will close randomly. (I wont say it crashes for the simple fact there is no crash report to tell me what happened it acts as if the game closed on its own) Despite the issues I experience I very much enjoy the game and will continue to run my 24/7 Route 66 gas station.

14 hour edit: Just got my first official crash, followed by my second, third, and fourth crash. In the span of 20 minutes after lowering my graphics settings to see if that may resolve the closing issue.

🌺8/10🌺
A great game. I played the free demo and the actual game itself but the game is great. As i said in the other review on the free version I would love it to be a multiplayer it would be honestly the best thing ever to play with your friends, especially when you expand your gas station in the real game so much by adding more fuel stations and car wash etc. It gets quite hard to keep up with everything so the game is less enjoyable at times and even stressful. I know you can hire staff to help you out but they get tired in a couple of in-game hours (so a couple of min in real time) and you basically work alone most of the time. You also do earn money quickly but as quickly as you earn it as quickly it disappears so the money is quite an issue sometimes. Id love to see multiplayer mode in this game for around 3 players per game. I love how you can customize quite a bit of things. Also the DLC for the price IS SO WORTH IT.
NOTE: you do need a decent PC to run the game normally. I run a brick (sh?t laptop) and i have trouble playing the game even on the lowest settings.

The game at it's core is very fun, very grindy game if you're into that, but as soon as you reach level 5 popularity in the game, it starts falling apart. It's not optimised properly and can't handle multiple entities in one area and will lag like hell no matter what you change the settings to. I'm not over exaggerating when I say the main minigames such as fueling cars becomes unplayable, hard to fill the car up to the right spot when you're running at 10 fps.

Can't in good faith recommend this game at it's current state, I'd be happy to change my review when the devs sort this issue out.

I feel more like this is a Gas Station *Employee* Simulator than a Gas Station *Manager* Simulator.

I'm unclear on why someone would enjoy being a gas station employee. 

Some of the highlights of this game's gameplay loop include:

- Cleaning up 25 bags of trash, in a row
- Mopping dirt off the floor constantly
- Picking up piles of sand and dumping them 10 feet away, over and over, forever
- Manually filling people's cars with gas like a basic b*tch from the '50s

Honestly you spend more time on menial labor than you do on, you know, running a gas station. Why do games always shy away from the business aspect in simulations? Let me manage employees, make my store profitable over time, expand to new locations, have competition and enemy gas stations, etc etc etc.

Instead I get to clean the word poop off my gas station's walls after the local hoodlum spray paints it there the 100th time. Yay?
Boring work.

I've played other simulator games before, and this one highly exceeded my expectations. It could feel repetitive to some as each task around the station requires a minigame, but I find it challenging and fun. As you expand, you can hire employees to help out. While it is buggy, the game allows you to reset your character and the npcs, so I've never ran into anything game-breaking. Some of the glitches I think are kind of funny (in a New Vegas kind of way). 

I really enjoy the added touch of customization. You can paint your walls, rearrange your store, and buy both indoor and outdoor decorations. I wish there was character customization, but you really don't see your character anyway.

If you like business-style games where you can be very hands-on (like House Flipper), you'll probably like gas station simulator.

I usually dont write reviews for game but i had to with this one. This game is fun and has a ton of potential. The only reason i give it a thumbs down is the poor optimization and the countless bugs and issues i encounter when this game first came out and have yet to be fixed. One example is objects going through the floor. It has almost been a year since the release date and their is no fix to it yet. One of the many examples that show you the pace of fixing issues in the game. Buy at your own will. The game is good and is tons of fun. Its current problems can be fixed if the devs decide to put in the time on it.

I see a ton of potential in this, but there's a lot of 'mini-games' that get in the way of what I'm wanting to do. I alt-f4ed out of the game because all I wanted to do was to clean up and maintain the gas station, not play some arbitrary mini-games that take too long and is too easy to screw up. 

It feels like punishment on top of punishment for playing the game. During the tutorial section that has you cleaning up all the trash, I was starting to think "oh yeah... I'm gonna love this game". It's a similar feeling to when you finish a section of a house in PowerWash simulator. I had all the little trash cleared out and the floor all swept up while running out to fuel up cars - I was digging it.

Then that creepy ass kid shows up and paints graffiti on the walls in the middle of all the other crapI'm trying to get done around the gas station. But to get the kid to go away, you've gotta throw something at him. Well, I don't have anything to throw at him because I JUST THREW IT ALL AWAY. So first I feel punished for trying to clean things up and not keeping trash around to throw at this kid. Then after the kid goes away and I try to paint over the graffiti, I've gotta play a mini-game that, if I screw it up (and I'm given several chances to do so PER WALL SEGMENT), I get punished again because paint gets splattered all over the ground. So because I cleaned up, I didn't have anything to throw at this kid who gives me another task to perform where I'm going to make a mess that... I have to clean up. Cleaning up = you'll have to clean more, but keep trash around = you won't have to clean as much. 

The worst part is the game seems like exactly the kind of thing I'd get sucked into for hours and hours and truly enjoy. Unfortunately, I just couldn't get past the hour mark.

Man, what a shame. 

Been following this one for a while now. Bought it this week but $hit, it's like the game doesn't want me to enjoy it...

The core gameplay loop is very, VERY fun. As the other reviewers say, it's pretty addicting. You just lose track how much time you dump to the game. There's always something to do, paint, figure out, organise exc. Progression was fun, as soon as I started to get bored from chores, employees unlocked. Balancing cash between gas, repair shop, products you sell, and upgrading your gas station was really, really enjoyable. If I saved some cash, I'd buy some decorations and slap them around the station here and there (more on this later). I played the game so hard, pretty much finished the story in 2 days. It was so satisfying to see a broken down small store with single pump to become a jewel of the desert with multiple employees running around, fixing cars, fueling, cleaning around, and selling stuff from the cash register. With the DLC, I really made an eye candy of a small business in the middle of the desert.

So why the negative review then? Man, the game needs sooo much improvement on QoL, movement, mouse / keyboard / UI annoyances, bugs and performance. It all comes back to my comment, "it's like the game doesn't want me to enjoy it". My pc is everything above the "recommended system requirements", but unfortunately, on medium settings I could barely pass 25, 30 FPS. Everything gets so much worse once you upgrade your parking lot and gas pumps, because all that means you get more cars and more customers. Gahhh damm, playing this game on 20 FPS avarage was still fun. I can even ignore the weird upside down walking - sitting in the car animation but walking in the shop - noodle arms and legs NPC's.  But around Fame level 7, $hit just starts to hit the fan too hard and game crashes VERY often bc there's so much going on. I wanted to push on, unlock and fully upgrade everything, but crashes being often as they are, I just gave up.

On the matter of DLC and customisation, I personally think it should have been included in the main game, but for the enjoyment I got from the game, I immediately purchased it to support the devs, especially since it was discounted. Unfortunately it doesn't really offer the customisation levels I expected. You can't paint walls with one click, or copy paste it on a different wall. You have to click, select the tile you want to install on a wall, seperately, every time. Considering there are 3 seperate buildings you could paint at the time of my progression, you can imagine the pain. There are some other QoL and freedom limits as to what and where you can paint that just makes customisation a pain in the a$$. You can't put decorations wherever you want too, there are specific spots and you can barely see them from all the shelves and other stuff in the shop. When I finished it, it looked kinda good, but man, it just drained my soul. 

Reason I went into this much detail was, hoping if the devs would see this review and act upon it. I really, honestly enjoyed the game and would like to come back again someday, but at this point that's not gonna happen with the state of the product.

I waited for this to go on sale as I wasn't willing to pay full price due to gameplay I'd seen. So, I bought it, willing to give it the benefit of the doubt.  SO!

Pros
- Perfect if you've got a few hours you need to waste as it definitely eats into your time
- The concept is great.

Unfortunately, that's kind of where the pros end... Now for the cons...

Cons
- Does not work very well with a controller. It's EXTREMELY awkward and half the mini games, like checking out customers and working on cars etc, the controller doesn't function at all. It's extremely janky. The controls for driving vehicles, is disgraceful. Forward/backward AND steering with the analogue stick? Are you kidding? This isn't 1996! Why is there no accelerator on a different button as standard?!
- The graphics aren't great... I'm able to play games at full 4k, with ray-tracing and everything and it doesn't even bother my PC. With all the graphic settings set to max, they still looked... Well.. Awful. Definitely not ''epic'' quality as the game states. More like 720p, 1080p at best.
- As many people have stated, the game crashes to desktop. A lot.
- Items flying up into the heavens... Funny at first but gets annoying SUPER quick
(EDITED: - 3/7/22) - I've recently discovered that sometimes, the mouse will stop functioning completely. You'll be clicking on stuff and it just won't do anything.
- Don't even get me started on object rotation... My OCD is FURIOUS with this!

At this point, I can't recommend the game unfortunately. Even after their ''hotfix'', there was nothing ''fix'' about it. Not when so many people are still mentioning the same issues. If these get sorted, I'll consider changing my review but until then, I really wouldn't bother, even while the game is on sale. Unless you REALLY want it. It's a shame because it has great potential. Just.. Not the right amount of love from the devs I guess.

Gas Station Simulator is a fun game and strangely addictive. There are some technical issues with it such as crashing and freezing, but there are also times where I can play this without these issues. Strange indeed. I'm just glad you're able to disable some features in the game such as Dennis the Menace and sand storms. Sand storms bring an extra element to the game play, but they happen too frequently. As for Dennis...it's an awful big desert so he would have conveniently disappeared after one too many visits to my gas station. Other than that Gas Station Simulator brings a different take on simulation games and the added DLC brings some added flavour to an already fun title. Cheers!

Would not recommend at this point in time. The game has a lot of promise, but both my fiance and I (who purchased at the same time & have the same amount of play time) have run into a massive amount of bugs.
We both have higher end machines, and the most recent drivers.

Some bugs:
- Crashes when picking a variety of items
- Delivery trucks getting stuck 400+ meters away and not moving after quitting the game, or resetting traffic
- Crashing when checking out customers

This game is so tacky, it becomes good again. The graphics and the mechanics are comparatively primitive, although the developer really went out of his way to invent mini-games and puzzles for the game which, together, could actually simulate a gas station. It's unclear in which timeframe the game is set, as the car models could easily come from the 50s, but you operate a computer to order supplies which looks like from the 90s. Nobody knows why the developer felt it necessary to give the gas station the backyard it has, and the price mechanics are strange: products you sell on the gas station can vary in costs, but apparently not the main product, gasoline. Customers rate you for successfully accomplished games and provided services, not for prices. If a car get's tangled up in occasionally appearing obstacles, you can broom them back on their way. That's about it.

A nice little simulator game. It's very short for a simulator, I'd pretty much exhausted the content by the 20 hour mark.

It's very janky in places, especially employee management. You'll see on the forums that people's biggest complaint is the employee management system. In fact in general there is far too much micromanagement required.

You spend the mid-late game just checking stock levels, ordering replacements, and managing staff rotas as there is no way to automate those processes.

It's certainly worth getting though as it's fun and engaging. It could certainly be improved and expanded much further.

I love this game for what it is.  Everything about the game is absolutely wonderful.

12 hours playing this game may seem like a lot, but it really isn't I have yet to unlock everything, but I am getting there.  This game takes you through a story like setting, but you're still pretty free to make your own decisions throughout the game.  This is an old gas station which the main characters uncle used to own I believe.  It's something like that so that could be somewhat wrong.  Anyways the uncle pops up here and there giving you money in the beginning and tips and tricks that you can used to help yourself throughout the game.  It's a good thing to have the money just handed to you in the beginning, but the uncle wants that money back eventually.  You're in the beginning of the game so it's actually pretty hard to pay him back.  The uncle has his people, as he is sort of like a mob boss.  

Other things that happen are sandstorms and a lot of them.  This is an annoying aspect of the game to me but being in a desert this makes sense because it would actually happen if this was real life.

My most favorite aspect of this game is that there are minigames incorporated with everything that you do.  Like the workshop has its own minigames, which you can unlock more of as you move on throughout the game. 

There are other little challenges such as fixing the water pressure and making sure you have enough stock.

All in all this game is absolutely fantastic.  If you are on the fence about this game just buy it you won't regret it. 9/10

Never did I think that I'd write a review about a gas station, however this particular gas station crossed my threshold. This gas station is on the same side of my building, therefore it's our go to place for snacks and gas, but not any more that's without a doubt! I've truthfully never encountered worse customer service in my life, it's as if the people who own it / work there, hate their customers. Time after time I've left here with a bad experience.

- a month ago my tire was flat, so I went inside to ask them to turn the air on, and the man said I needed to pay one dollar which shocked me because no other station has ever charged for air. I had to fill the air though and said okay then I'll pay with my card since I don't have cash on me. He said I can't pay with card for only 1 dollar. He literally didn't help me out at all, what has humanity come to? I would've just turned it on if I were in his position but he didn't. Thankfully a kind gentleman and his wife heard the conversation & paid for me. Then the very next day another woman in front me asked for the air to be turned on & he did not charge her at all & turned it on for free. When my fiancé asked him why he didn't turn the air on for me the day before, he said the lady goes there all the time so he didn't charge. Well guess what we are also there all the time, and that was clear DISCRIMINATION!

The experience I had today made me know for sure that from now on I'll NEVER go to this place again. Unfortunately I don't have water at home & rely on bottled water for drinking. This morning I realized I was all out, so I took my dog out for a walk and decided to quickly stop inside and purchase a bottle. My dog is actually a certified service dog, I carry his identification card in my wallet at all times incase of issues. As soon as I stepped in I quickly grabbed a bottle of water and took my money out to pay, and instantly the worker shouted at me saying "NO DOGS ALLOWED IN HERE I WILL CALL THE POLICE AND YOU WILL PAY 300 DOLLARS!"

I have never been so humiliated, who does this guy think he is shouting at me like that? It is completely unacceptable and disrespectful. He could have informed me politely by saying in a calm tone that they don't allow animals inside, then I would've showed my dogs I.d. Card.

I was raised to show respect to everyone, however the people who work here clearly have no respect or common curtesy. I will never give them business again & I will tell every single person I know not to give this place business. Shame on these people, they are exactly what's wrong with society.

The game is fun and charming, but it's in an unacceptable state for a title that's not "early access," especially considering the team are working on DLC and other games.

- Regular crashes to desktop causing lost progress -- I think I've had around 5-6 in 9 hours gameplay
- Terrible AI/pathfinding -- employees & customers get stuck on things, cars drive headfirst into other cars causing the whole system to become backed up with no customers able to enter
- 90% of time when I pick up a trash bag it disappears through the floor
- Major issues with responsiveness; sometimes clicking doesn't do anything even though you have "focus" on something
- Dennis is introduced as someone I have to chase off the property. Aside from the tutorial, I have literally never seen him even once even though I'm always running around doing things at the station. His graffiti still spawns however
- When scanning items at the checkout, sometimes they just physics bug outta there before you even touch them, giving you negative feedback from the customer

There is a fantastic game at its heart, but I can't recommend it in its current state. It needs TLC badly.

Honking simulator 2022..

It's a fun game with more to it then you think, and that makes it a fun game.
At the start,,forget sitting there casualy sipping you morning coffe having a zen moment.. Aint gonna happen, there's stuff to do ^^ Well you can, but customers will stack up, and that's probably not a good thing in the end.
I'd call it a management game along with the simulator tag, a light vanilla one, but still, the aspect is there managing employees, filling up the warehouse with things being sold and so on. 
Also chasing that lil pest Dennis that keep tagging your station. My favourite weapon of choice it to throw a big a** sink in his head when he comes running. Usually does the trick.
You clean up the place, level up to unlock more stuff and buildings, level up you reputation being a nice capable station owner and so on.

Are there bugs? well not bugs per se as far as I've seen, more quirks that annoy me. like some cars "hitbox" are so big so when refulling you have to run around them to get to the pump, trash can't be rotated making it a frustrating throwing it in the containers if it's large trash like planks and what not.

(A little edit before reading below..it came to my attention that there is a option to turn off car horns for sweet sweet silence, though some honking could be nice, but not every 5s ^^ So me calling it HonkSim22 still stands valid ) ;)

AND this is the part making me call it honking simulator..
All customers in this game are total a**hats with ZERO patiens or respect, so when that poor guy that refills my gas is at the back is refulling, he is blocking the only way out (God forbid they'd drive around him) hence they run their cars straight up his "Trallalaa" and honk their horn every 3-5s or so and guess what, on a busy day the cars stack up behind him.
My kingdom for a shotgun ingame to go Falling Down on them in true Michael Douglas style.
Also that delivery guy at mu warehouse,,he is also a total d***, honking while I'm opening the door..dude the door can't open any faster, chill!
*Breathes heavily with blood pressure closing in on 230/130* ;)

That said.. Fun game, worth the money and they are still doing updates and a second DLC incoming.
/recomended 10/10 would buy earplugs again

I'd hold off for now, there are some serious issues with the game currently.

-Game crashes to desktop intermittently
-Frame rate crashes are common
-items will fall through the world
-during some mini games items will freak out and penalize you because of janky physics interactions (think g-mod)
-No way to sell/remove excess placeable decorations or shelves
-Pretty much everything was a pre-made asset based on the lack of congruity in design
-All the honking, I swear Bangladesh, Egypt, and New York combined couldn't match the amount of honking in the game
-It's supposed to be in america but it uses british terms/units for things (Bathroom/Restroom is acronymed as WC for Water Closet, fuel is done in liters, not gallons, etc.)
-You have no inventory management tools but are expected to manage inventories for goods
-Shelving units hold very little for their size due to sheer inefficiency of space usage which makes no sense for a convenience store
-a can of snuff (chewing tobacco) takes as much room in the warehouse as a replacement car tire as the ware house stores based on individual items, not on number of cases of goods
-You can't clean the walls, you can only repaint them, and they get so dirty you have to repaint them like, every 4 days
-Lots of misalignment issues (Shelves can't be squared to walls, the tire mini game has holes in the rotors to 'screw' the lugnuts into that don't align with the holes on the old or new tire, some walls extend past where they are, etc)
-Trash and dirt can generate in areas customers can go to but the player cannot (namely, inside bathroom stalls)
-garbage cans fill up in a way that makes sense for game mechanics, where as the dumpsters you put the trash in are 'let play jenga with wonk physics and no item rotational controls for placement!' which makes some larger pieces of garbage and trash nigh impossible to get rid of without taking an absurd amount of time
-Removing/placing lugnuts place a cheap electric drill sound, like the kind you use to drive screws, which is just plain silly
-Cops drive around with their lights on at all times
-Delivery drivers for shop goods get out of their trucks and wait for you to put everything in the warehouse shelves PRIOR to moving to get back in the truck making it take at least 2x as long than it should for unloading based on how small of quantities you can actually order in due to how the warehouse works
Addicting

This was definitely one of those games that I first saw on the store page and thought why would I want to run a gas station, surely this would be over pretty quickly, I can now say I was 100% wrong. 

After buying this game I thought I'm just going to nip and have a quick go to see what it's all about, that's where my first mistake was, many hours later I finally managed to save the game, close it down & go to bed, once the sun had come up. 

It's surprising how addictive this game is, from working the checkout and scanning items through the till, to sweeping the floor and emptying the bins, and taking them out to the skips outside, not to forget to remember to go outside and fuel up people's cars. Not only remembering to do all that you have to remember to keep a check on your stock levels for fuel and items in the warehouse for your shelves. 

Then when you level up enough you get to add the workshop to tackle cars, from flat tyres, cracked mirrors and scratches on the paintwork. Once you level up more items get added to that like coolant and oil changes, too flat batteries and spark plugs. It can get very busy at the gas station but luckily help is on hand when you get to the level to employ staff. 

It was a massive step once the carwash became available, washing your first car and paying gustaf a visit down in the sewers. And once you hit the right level you can flip the switch to turn the car wash to automated, and watch the money roll in. 

One thing to watch out for is Denis running around graffitiing your walls, definitely keep an eye on him and have the paint brush ready to paint over his lovely artwork. 

There's so many more things I could tell you about this game, but the one thing I will say is go buy it and enjoy it for yourself because you will lose a lot of hours playing it. 

Not to mention the new upgrades and DLC that just came out, I can't wait to get back to my gas station to enjoy the upgrades.

Okay let's address the controversy first. At the moment I would gladly like to recommend the game on sale (I purchased at a $16 price tag). Although I cannot recommend at full price. Mainly because of the DLC. Now I wouldn't be bothered by the DLC if they didn't lock progression like gas station levels, employees to hire, and popularity levels behind the paid DLC. Those are things that arguably should be added as free DLC. Honestly the other things sold in the DLC are worth the DLC price alone so making progression free would only encourage others to buy the DLC (because really the only reason I'm getting the DLC is for the cosmetic options). Now let's talk gameplay. It's a very fun minigame fest/ management sim. Some minigames are great like working the register or workshop, but others are tedious and annoying like painting (Seriously. The bigger your place gets the longer you'll spend playing that boring minigame of just pressing RMB to keep a marker inside a green zone while you stare at a wall. I'd rather have that minigame removed entirely since it slows down the gameplay way too much). Managing your store is good as well, but there is still one really annoying flaw with cleaning. The floor blends footprints too well. Had so many times when I couldn't fill my cleanliness meter because there was one footprint I could not find and it drove me insane (a simple fix would just be to either change the default floor or to highlight dirty spots when you pull out the broom like how it highlights trash when you pull out a trash bag). Placing things can be pretty annoying as well (please add an option to snap objects in 45-90 degree angles as well as snap to a grid so it can be easier to make everything line up straight). Now for features I would really like devs to add if they actually end up reading this: First if we can get an option to play music playlists over an intercom from youtube or your own personal library so you can play your own music while you work (becasue who hasn't dreamed of being able to control what music plays at work lol). Second is to add Multiplayer some day (I know that's a giant request but it's sad simulator games don't take advantage of multiplayer since that'd add so much more meme potential and longevity alone). Lastly An option to not have everything open would be nice. I don't care for running a workshop as much as I do care for running the station so If there was an option to just close the workshop and keep the gas station open (or vice versa) then that would be great. Thanks for this great game. You guys did a great job overall. looking forward to future content. :)

This review is as of the "Can Touch This" add-on.  The game itself has potential, but needs a great deal of work. The early stages can be addicting enough, but quickly becomes extremely tedious.  As you upgrade your Gas Station, you would think the money would come in faster, but it is the opposite.  You can not keep up with all the tasks, cannot hire enough people fast enough to tend to the many tasks, cannot maintain an inventory of fuel or goods, and you certainly will not be paying back any loans on time.  The economy and mechanics are a mess.  For example, after opening the Repair shop, if you run out of inventory or cannot get to the customers in time, there is no way to close it until you recoup some money, hire a Mechanic or get inventory.  You are just stuck watching your popularity go down.  The Devs needs to play test and polish, but instead they add DLC that is equally broken.  Maybe in time this will be worth trying, but right now I would avoid.

Great fun game. It's still a work in progress for sure but it's only gotten better with these updates. I wish there were more of a selection of products to buy. It's really fun at times until you progress, then it's so chaotic that it becomes tedious. You don't/can't sleep, and the customer traffic is insane. You can hire up to three employees, however you, as the owner, must act like an employee, even after you complete everything. Emptying trash and cleaning floors, and painting walls. Your gas station? You can't afford doors. I mean, this seems to be the only reason they didn't include them, because they aren't available. In the Desert, with sand, that gets everywhere. Employees can only work so long, and there are too many items to manage for it to be fun later, but at least you can enjoy it early. Bugs are there, however nothing absolutely game breaking at the time of this review, and can be kind of funny seeing someone float through your building like they are driving a car. More building expansion and employee hiring are badly needed to make the game worth it. Despite this, it's worth it for the beginning, just don't expect satisfaction at the end, just chaos.

Edit: After Car Wash and latest patch.. Adding more complexity to chaos does not make for a satisfying experience. Garbage ray gun... was an addition to the game and has a net 0 effect on game play. Removing the need to paint, and adding inventory data from your warehouse are welcome additions, allowing the ability to not have to wait for drivers to exit delivery trucks is a step forward. That said,  the end game is still tedious without the ability to hire a manager, work with employee shifts, or hire an additional employee. An automated ordering system needs to be added to another warehouse level. Product diversity needs to be expanded.Allow users to customize their own apartment.. not that they can ever use it. ADD DOORS. Yes, this will limit your view of the front of the store for fuel customers, and yes, it will limit your view on the back door for deliveries, however you get notices of customers and deliveries, plus employees can do it later. PLEASE FOR THE LOVE OF ALL THAT IS HOLY ADD DOORS. Limit the sweeping, you're in a desert without doors... YOU ARE IN A DESERT WITHOUT DOORS WITH STRANGELY FREQUENT DUST STORMS. I would buy a 99 cent DLC that just added doors, nothing else, just doors with a wonderful little chime when customers enter. Is this hard? Why is this so hard? WHY WON'T YOU GIVE US DOORS? Do you need me to start a gofundme? Just say the word, I will start the "developers can't afford doors to a gas station in a desert" gofundme. I mean think about it.. a wooden door with a little golden bell... a large steel door.. star trek style auto opening doors... supermarket style auto open doors, ornate castle doors with a moat.. it's all in your power.. you can do it... please...
It's okay.

In defense of Drago....

I'm not a geek nor hardcore gamer.  And like most, once the latest update was released I shook my head and cussed them out.  Well, apparently I shook my head and screamed long enough it jarred something loose. 

Other than 1 crash after achieving a level upgrade and while not having experienced EVERY bug people are ranting about since the latest update, those I've experienced (guess  over 50%) CAN be overcome and I dare say ARE part of the game. 

It requires thinking totally outside the box....or having dementia.  Logic and common sense don't always apply. If you can remember that, it's a game changer.

My opinion of this game has gone even higher once this method to Drago's madness was understood.

 There is a fine line between insanity and genius.  Drago crosses the line on both sides.

I have played a lot of simulators over my years of gaming.  Some i get bored of and some i highly enjoy. Well I am proud to say Gas Station Simulator is an enjoyable one. As person who has horrible work hours and an adult who rarely has time for long game sessions this is a good fit. The game play is fun and addictive. The game is fun, I would give it an overall (if you like simulation) 7/10. There are some tedious/odd behaviors in the game, and there are some features in dire need, like most games, but overall it's decent if you want to spend $20 on a game, as I feel it's worth that. 

Tedious features: 
- Limit of 5 employees but none can do stocking/procurement (ordering) 

QOL features needed: 
- At least 2 more employees; 1 for stocking continual on the shelves and 1 for ordering, they can work in the warehouse, gives it more use 
- Paint that lasts longer (I live in AZ and we paint our houses about every 3-5 years, not every 3-5 weeks) 
- Fuel trucks that don't block traffic 

Nonsense existing features: 
- Fuel trucks that block traffic flow 
- Customers that complain and ask if you're ripping them off when you give them free items 
- A car wash that has a dirt path on exit (literally no sense made here) 

Would like to see Workshop opened for this game I believe modders in many cases in many games make games much better than the developers can, as modders listen to communities in most cases.

An excellent mindless sandbox management game.

You spend your time doing mundane minigames with no real challenge to them, eventually you grow your gas station into a large tourist spot.

I found many angles of the game oddly satisfying, and there is a baked-in sense of humor to most things. It is 100% a Dad-Game/Time Waster. If it weren't for the complex mechanics of the game itself, it would have no issue being a mobile hit. Unusually, this is not to it's detriment.

You can min-max the hell out of this game. I think it's theoretically possible to handle 4-5 employee tasks by yourself. Having employees merely takes the weight off so you can attempt a 24/365 station.

That being said, very buggy, very crash-prone. Most players do not recommend you try to run the station for longer than a few days before closing to "reset the cache" of the game, basically. The game does auto-save regularly, and the game loop itself lends to crashes not having much impact on your fun.

Look up the best-performance settings for this game if you want to play it. The stock graphics settings had the frame rate so choppy I almost gave up then and there.

I recommend playing it if you're into mindless task-sinks, but look up the setup for graphics/performance/errors, this will crash, and the frame-rate without is abysmal.

Game goes from super slow boring pace to so fast that you can't juggle everything, you can't stop one part of your store and work on another for example so you have to swap between tasks rapidly getting a little whiplash. The main issue is that the game runs terribly, even on low graphics you'll often have the game get sudden stuttering that requires tabbing out or a full restart to fix, otherwise you play a slower and slower powerpoint until you can't even open the menus.

Basically if you want a decent game, and have a modern pc with plenty of spare RAM, you can probably enjoy this. If you have a pc a couple years old with other games installed you might want to steer clear, especially since the gameplay is a less-polished house flipper, with minor mechanics such as toy car racing or lockpicking which you never use after the tutorial.

Edit: So since my refund was refused despite the technical issues I've been playing some more, and my opinion has been expanded. Firstly lockpicking can be used on cars for tiny amounts of cash that frankly aren't worth it, deliveries take forever and supplies are so expensive that backlogging wheels or other car-repair parts is pretty useless. The car wash takes forever, and is highly unsatisfying compared to Powerwash Simulator that it takes the mechanic from, dust-vision included. (They didn't even change the colour.) Repairing vehicles feels very clunky and slow despite trying to make you feel like it's against the clock with it's countdown. 
BUT
Unlocking the ability to hire workers to perform tasks FOR you is certainly a saving grace for this game, but that made me realise...this game is so unfun that the best part is having the game play itself for you...
Guess I'll keep playing to get achievements and will note down any changes in opinion later.
Also I'm playing on the lowest graphics settings, NPC's will sit down in midair and fly to their car, or have parts of their flesh clip to other parts of them, such as hands to foreheads or hair to feet. The game still will freeze and even be unresponsive when loading a save, and when most of the mechanics are reflex based the freezes are a big issue. The progression of the game is FAR TOO SLOW. You should be hiring people and getting the business moving twice as soon at least!
Edit 2: Just had a crash-to-desktop for no discernible reason...yay.

Edit 3: Nevermind 11/10 ||the spaceship crahses into the airplane.||
The reward for completing the game is useless because it provides a defensive tool against a problem you can just...turn off in settings? 
Honestly this game was a laggy repetitive mess, if they aimed for a management simulator they seem to have talent in designing that, but as a first person experience with minigames this was extremely dull and buggy. I hope the upcomming DLC makes players who enjoy this game happy though, everyone likes their own things, I just happen to not like this.

I was apprehensive buying this game because reviews listed some serious problems. I waited about 6 months to buy it in the hope patches would improve the game and glad I did because I had a smooth and enjoyable experience.

Gas Station Simulator is a really fun sim game. The premise is simple, you buy a dilapidated gas station in the middle of the desert, you slowly restore and upgrade it by serving customers, earning money and upgrading your facilities to unlock more services. It's starts off basic, you clean up the small building by picking up trash, throwing it out into a large skip to be collected and taken away, you sweep up the mess, and restore your gas pump. Now you can serve customers, you have to arrange deliveries of gas and then manually serve each customer to make a profit.

As you progress you expand your building size, you can add a shop where you order goods, stock shelves and serve customers. Meanwhile you unlock decorations for your gas station, expand the building size, add toilets, add more parking spaces to allow for more customers. In the later game you unlock a garage where you can perform maintenance on customers vehicles, and lastly you unlock a wash station with a power washer. Things become very hectic by this point so you unlock the ability to employ staff who you can instruct to automate different jobs like operating pumps, cleaning etc.

The game has a lot of breadth to it but not a lot of depth, there's a lot to do in different areas, but each task is relatively simple. Management doesn't allow things like setting prices and balancing books, you just order goods. Most of the manual tasks to pump gas, wash cars or serve customers are simple yet enjoyable mini games which take less than a minute. Most of the fun comes with the sense of progress as you expand and improve your station from a dirty run down hut to a large well decorated efficient station.

I got about 25 hours out of the game to finish the main storyline and unlock everything. People have mentioned bugs like crashing, I only had 1 crash to desktop. People also mentioned performance, it ran fine for me in 4k max settings and the game looks really quite nice for a sim, however I do have an RTX 3080. Performance does dip later in the game because there's way more customers and buildings unlocked but it wasn't significant for me, there's a lot of graphical options to lower if you have an older PC. There still is a few minor bugs, nothing game breaking. People also complained about painful loading times but again for me with a good PC they were very fast. If you have an older PC then I'd recommend trying the free demo first to gauge performance.

Definitely worth the asking price for fans of sim games.

I see what the game is trying to be, it's nowhere near fleshed out yet but the bones are there for a decent your-effort-counts sim.
The problems are technical, well and a really negative business practice.

Ok the game is HARD on your GPU.  My 2080 Super sits at the power limit 100% of the time at full tilt.  It delivers a steady 60fps but jesus your hardware works for it.  To put it in perspective, no other game taxes the GPU so hard.  Not satisfactory, not Elden Ring, no any other unity game Ive come across.  The devs really need to work on engine efficiency here.  
Then there are the glitches, bugs and the like but I suppose they can be expected for a early access game.  But there lies the issue.  The devs are announcing DLC for a game that is not yet released.  Worse the DLC is just parts of the game design currently missing from the game as it is now.  

This could be a good game but right now it is shallow with many facets missing, it's not anywhere near done.  
It's a resource monster, great if you need to heat your room up and don't mind the power bills.  
The developers are coming across seriously greedy.

Buyer beware.

Also there is an achievement where you need race a car, (in this game?!) its hard and annoying and everyone have problem with that (checked internet cause i thought its my fault) Why?! :/

Seriously, it is OK.  At the time of this writing I'd sunk 32 hours into it.  Got my moneys worth.  Not sure why people are gushing over it saying it is the best sim ever.  If it is, the others must really, really suck.  I give it a solid 5/10.

The only way to give suggestions for the improvement of the game seems to be a rather convoluted procedure through discord.  After viewing the spat that the mods had with someone who had - perhaps like me not understood discord - taken the time to type out their thoughts, I said "I will not bother.  Hopefully they will take the time to make a more friendly 'John Q Public' way of giving feedback in the future.  Though I will possibly buy some DLC in the future, speaking with hostile people in hopes of helping them is not high on my priority list.

Edit:  Something they did VERY right - in this game and Food Truck Simulator - was a professional 'you can remap the control keys to whatever you want'.  Without that, I don't even play the game.

Gas Station Simulator is terrific for the first 6 or so hours. If you're anything like me, you're going to want to continue for a long time after those 6 hours; before you get to the point where it becomes exhausting. Despite your efforts, you're hardly getting anything for it. Trying to get to [spoiler] the end of the game where you need to give your Uncle $5000 [/spoiler] is an incredibly slow process, as expenses will all-round get the better of you, and you have to make peace with the fact that you can't make your station look beautiful without sacrificing someone needing their car washed, car fixed, whatever. Certainly, you can prioritise painting, at the expense of losing potential profit, which you really can't afford to do. 
There's so many factors at play, you lose sight of the enjoyment of productivity, and start worrying about income and wanting to be able to afford the next shelf, paying an employee or purchasing the next level of building. Let alone buying decorations.

This game is grand! I've wanted this game for a while now and i got it. I fully appreciate this game most definitely. Here's some pro's and cons for you dev's who made this game.

Pro's:
Keeps you intertwined for hours. (I played this for 4 hours straight when it was done downloading.)
There's almost literally everything you can do in this game.
The graphics really do actually look good. Even on lower settings. (Mines is set to medium to not kill my laptop)
All around it's an amazing experience playing this game. I really can't say much more besides it's Fantastic. Litereally no other words to describe it. Honestly. Sims like these are the best to play. Specially something like this.

Now for the hard part..

Con's:
There's no running, which sucks when i have like 10 cars sitting out and i have to try my best to get to everyone of them at a steady walking pace.
The LMB doesn't always work when it needs to. I had a perfect 40 car gas line. The one time, i had everything perfect. And it didn't click and went over so i clicked more times and it finally worked.
Ruby doesn't always work with controls, runs clunky and doesn't always pick up the sand. I'll hold the button, and it won't work, I'll let go and click 100 times then it'll work.
Sand doesn't always get picked up or go away after three times of picking it up. Like in front of the car wash. I tried picking it up but none of it has moved anywhere.
The glitches with the NPC's cars and objects. Take a tire off then go to pick it up and it jus fall's through the floor. I don't know how may tires i have in my workshops floor, but there's A LOT at this point.
Picking up trash or anything like that doesn't always work when it need's to. It does the same thing as the tires in the workshop. it jus fall's through the ground. Or flips around like it is goat simulator. That get's old when trying to clean up the station.


Other than that. Everything about this game really is amazing. I actually really love this game and I'm NOT giving it up. AS i said in the Pro's, this game is fantastic. I mean that. Jus those few thing's would be great if they got fixed. If you guys are already working on a patch for them awesome. If not. 
Please please PLEASE come out with a patch for that. This game is wonderful. I apperciate that you did make it and again, I'm never giving this game up. I watched Markiplier play it and i wanted it. I hadn't heard about it till then. Thank oyu for making this game. It really is awesome. Jus please Please PLEASE make a fix to those things. THis game would be 20% better. It's already 3,000,000% amazing. So the 3,000,020 Would be even better.
Thank you for making this game and I will suggest it to people more regardless of Con's.
Thank you Dev team. You're all fantastic human beings. And wonderful People.

DNS or domain name server is a server that is used for converting ip adresses and domain names. It is split into two groups, forward lookup zone and reverse lookup zone. Forward is used for converting domain names to ip adresses, while reverse is used for converting Ip adresses to domain names. When you request an adress the DNS server checks if it has it, and if it does sends it back. Then the adress is saved in a DNS cache in your local host. If it is not capable of converting, then it is sent up the hierarchy of dns servers and then sent down through the different layers untill it is found. For this to be possible a route has to be found. The most common routing protocoll used today for routing is BGP or border gate protocoll. It finds a relatively fast route to the target destination and then send the IP packages. For all this to work everything has to be split up into some sort of categorization, and that categorization is called the OSI modell.
It is split into 7 parts. 
Application
Presentation
Session
Transport
Network
Network access layer
Physical
ADD MULITYPLAYER

Starts out fun, but instead of evolving into a management sim once you've done your share of manual labor, it decides to introduce respawning sand piles that you have to remove with the clunkily controlled excavator if you don't want cars to get bugged.

The rewarding feeling of having a neatly painted gas station doesn't last, because within a few hours the paint starts degrading and you can do the whole thing again. Fun!

Car washing seems to be inspired by PowerWashing Simulator but completely misses the satisfying feeling and just feels clunky instead.

Also had 2-3 crashes, but luckily only lost a few minutes of progress; and some general bugs, like weirdly moving people, and objects not following you correctly or clipping through the floor once grabbed.

Overall a good attempt that suffers from questionable design choices, lack of automatability and bugs.

I like the gameplay, but I can't recommend this game in its current state. When things are going well, you'll keep playing the game for hours. However, you'll quickly encounter many bugs that may take the fun away or even block you from progressing. These bugs include problems such as you not getting the fuel you have paid for, customers not moving at all (thus blocking the gas pumps and the garage, forcing you to "call the aliens"), and of course crashing. There are a lot of less severe flaws such as pathfinding issues for both the employees and the customers, but they don't prevent you from enjoying the game.

In summary, I don't recommend that you get the game yet. If you want to buy the game while it's still on sale, don't go over the 2h mark in case the bugs start, well, bugging you. Then you can save a bit of money and get a good game for a good price if they ever fix it, and return it if they don't.

Ps. I'll change the review from negative to positive when the game is stable on my PC. After all, it is a good game when you disregard its issues!

Update 17.3.2022

I tried another run after a long break (five months), but couldn't even get my fuel refilled (one of the first tasks in the game). It upsets me that bugs are nowadays such an issue everywhere. I suppose that I blame the developers (not fixing the game, but releasing new ones like China knockoff products), but I guess I'm the stupid one for buying the game.

I have no idea why, but this game is just...fun. Its this weird combo of planning out how to push more profit in a business sim with weird...everything from the your customers to party buses with people in alien cosplay. Then you have to go into a sewer to feed a crocodile trash so your car wash has enough water.... I can't even explain it its just a well made business sim of owning a run-down gas station in the middle of the desert with a ton of crazy quirks.

I played this gamer to help me keep my mind busy as it tends to wander into dark places, this game def helps with that and the sense of accomplishment when you catch up on stock. The only thing I'd like to see added is how much of anything you already have in your warehouse so that you know when to buy stock and not overload yourself.

[b]Overall Score:[/b] 4/5

[b]Gameplay:[/b] 4/5
I played through the short story. It's nothing too fancy, but it is what you'd expect from a game like this. The game can feel tedious in a bad way at times, but mainly when you're using the register and the damn item didn't scan, or you somehow caused another item to fly off the screen before it was scanned. [b]The game is buggy at times, it may crash occasionally. That doesn't stop the game from being enjoyable as long as it works.[/b] Overall, I would recommend this game to anyone who enjoys a good sim game or a game to chill on. Just watch where your broom goes, you could send a car into the next dimension.

[b]Graphics/Appearance:[/b] 5/5
The graphics aren't cutting edge AAA graphics, but for a sim game like it this, the graphics are pretty adequate. The interfaces are easy to use, but my main gripe is that when I'm purchasing outdoor decorations, the game takes a bit to respond. Overall, though, I don't have many complaints about the game.

[b]Audio:[/b] 3/5
The ambient sound and music is great, but the voice lines are very commonly repeated and are slightly annoying at times. I understand the game is probably developed by a small team, maybe even 1-2 people in total, but sometimes hearing the same "Super!" line from the same voice actor, two customers in a row gets a bit old. Also, the horns. The excessive horn spam is honestly the worst part of the game. I don't mind a horn or two here or there, but hearing 4 or 5 cars honking endlessly because the fuel truck is refueling my pumps makes me want to bonk these cars into another dimension with my god broom.

[b]Challenge/Management:[/b] 4/5
The game isn't super challenging, but can be a bit stressful when you got yourself a party bus and the 30-40 people that seem to appear out of thin air are creating a mess of your floors and emptying your stock while you also have several cars to refuel and a car to repair. Having employees is a must. I would like to see a shift manager eventually though. Having to figure out if my register still has an employee on it by walking through the building and seeing 6 dudes in line isn't fun. It would be nice to see a feature where I can enable an auto pay (so long as I have money in the bank), and employee 1 can work days, while employee 2 works nights.

[b]Variety:[/b] 4/5
Sim games either have a lot of variety within their topic of choice or not at all. GSS has a decent amount of variety right now, but teases more (maybe a later update?). There's just enough to enjoy, while not being too much where it becomes overwhelming. Just make sure you keep your shelves stocked.

As far as indie simulation games go, Gas Station Simulator does a reasonable job of delivering somewhat challenging gameplay with a decent progression system. But it doesn't take long until it all becomes a humdrum experience. The game's performance goes awry, and crashes become very frequent as soon as you build the bus stop. 

Balance-wise, the garage feels like a waste of time and money as you progress, and failing to pay loans isn't as punishing as rewarding if you're broke and your warehouse is empty. Sometimes I'd rather not pay the loan and just let the mafia take away my soft drinks so that I could get another loan and repeat the cycle.

Furthermore, it's very concerning how the developers seem to have a hard time focusing on a single project. This game is not even close to being finished and polished, yet they are already developing not one but [b][i]TEN[/i][/b] other simulators with reused assets and awful performance. I can't help but agree with other players and feel the developers decided to take the shovelware route.

It was a tough choice to leave a negative review, but as it stands this is a £5 value game, not £15. Here's why.

The first 10 hours of the game are pretty solid fun. You'll get to take a gas station from nothing to a fully functioning hub including a garage and lots of products to sell, and you'll have employees running tasks for you too. 

Sometime after that it gets a bit grindy, and you'll start to notice lag. Turns out the more you unlock your car park spaces, and the more customers you therefore get, the laggier the game becomes. There's definitely an issue here because it gets laggier and laggier indefinitely, until you hit the "reset customer" switch at which point you're back to a smooth 120 fps. Major bug - needs fixing.

At around the 13 hour mark you'll finish the main quest, but there's still plenty to unlock. However, the game just seems to be incomplete at this stage:-
- Random "challenges" to help gain station rep are either impossible (serve 40 customers in 3 minutes?! with one kiosk?) or broken (get 40 tips in 5 minutes - practically impossible but the tips you get don't count so it's always 0/40 anyway)
- Station rep after level 7 is about 1% per 20 minutes, and there's nothing new or fun to help you grind (seems the challenges could fix this, if they worked)
- The car wash is, unfortunately, just not enjoyable. Even at level 3 it lacks any real fun factor; and the money you get from it doesn't scale upwards at all despite it being the most expensive thing to upgrade.

Here's my suggestions to the devs, to make this game 100% stellar:
- Add player progression i.e. skill tree. Even the employees have skills to level up, so it seems an oversight that the player does not. Ideas off top of my head: [FUEL] Increased income from fuel tips, lower fuel consumption. [REGISTER] Belt gets dirty slower (levels 1-5, 5 is no dirty belt at all?), increased income from tips. [MAINTENANCE] wider brush radius, larger bag / bin capacity, faster painting, slower car wash blockages. [MECHANIC] Lower component prices, increase tip income (nb i'm not even sure you can get tips yet, but make it possible if not), Add #chances to lock picking. [MANAGER] Reduce staff payments, increase walking speed, accept warehouse deliveries automatically, unlock product auto-replenish
- Let staff get tips too, from say skill level 7 being 50% change to 90% chance at level 10. 
- Add recycling bin at the garage to either get a small income on used up old tyres/garage components (when you order trash pickup) or randomly generate new components every so often
- Add an extra kiosk on max garage upgrade
- Make the car wash more effective with each upgrade, and give better income from the customers. Add a sponge/bucket to pick up to quickly wipe in a large radius.
- Add crouch to the game, or lift cars up on the car wash a little.
- Add the capability to clean walls which can be levelled up and is much faster than re-painting.
- Have painted, clean walls influence garage reputation gain
- Allow outdoor decorations to be placed freely (except on "roads")
- Add auto-replenish feature - accessed from computer. Can set parameters like max price per product, only buy product when price is green, % shelf space to fill, and an overall "min cash in bank" setting to make sure player account isn't emptied. Can also drag/drop products to prioritise which to buy when cash is low, and set a schedule/trigger (1 delivery per... or deliver when stock is...).
- Fix challenges, although with the above changes they might be more viable anyway. But some of them don't work at all so review them and overhaul.

Super on the fence about this game, I bought it this morning and on my free day basically just lost track of time and played all day, which is a good sign. But slowly you start noticing a few things that just ruin the fun.

The reason it was on my wishlist was actually because of Josh Strife Plays, who interviewed one of the employees/owner I think of DRAGO about another game. I personally am not really attracted to the whole route 66 theme. But I do love a good simulation game and therefore bought it.

Whilst writing this review, I still don't know what rating to give this game. I had fun, but I can name a mile of negatives. So here we go with my + and - list.

Positives:
+ Its a solid simulation game with a good theme
+ There is some story, but not real deep
+ Every task has a fun mini game
+ You can decorate your own store
+ Gameplay loop is nice, you'll lose track of time
+ Very satisfying to go from a dump to a nice running gas station

Negatives:
- They opt for realism in a lot of things, like the painting job of your walls will fade over time/get dirty. So you have to repaint them. Which is fine, but the walls have a clear line of sections where you paint. So you pretty much end up with walls always having these very obvious lines on them. Either give the line a fade, or don't make the paint fade at all.
- Speaking of the painting of the walls, you could say just repaint them. But you barely have time to do so. You almost always get overwhelmed with tasks. You think to hire an employee, but you're very limited in the amount. And you can't make the employee "do whatever is needed", only 1 specific task.
- The menu's for getting decorations and features is very confusing. It's easy to forget which menu is which and buying the upgrades is very slow. Plus you have 0 choice in what types of decoration you buy (at least outside of your shop). It's just padding to spend money to 100% the game.
- I've no idea why lockpicking is in the game. Maybe it's just me, but I just don't wanna steal things in my simulation game, or at least have a choice to. I didn't lockpick at all aside from the tutorial, so I have no idea if it gives benefits.
- Cleaning cars takes ages, so I just closed the car wash as soon as I completed the quest.
- I'm very easily scared, thus why I like to go for simulation type games. I know there is a sense of realism and probably won't be scared. Game broke my faith by me having to go in the sewers and hearing a growl not knowing what it is, then later I saw it was a crocodile in the water. After I HAD to move through the water. Scared the shit out of me, was debating to quit.
- Theres still some bugs, like a lot of the time when I pick things up, they don't move with my cursor. I fix it by repicking it up. Not that bad, just a bit annoying. Also sometimes the trash just dissapeared into the ground or something, not sure if that was a good or a bad thing. And the grey haired people look like they have glowing white hair, even though I have max settings.
- Cash register mini game makes NO sense, why not have the basked on the other side of the register? Well, to make the mini game actually have some challenge to not have it fall in. But if it does fall in, it's given for free and you lose money, but that's not the only thing. If you give away stuff for free, the customer is UNHAPPY? Why? Also I failed the minigame several times because of the item just getting yeeted into oblivion without  me doing anything.

I really really want to give this a positive review. But I think I just can't. There's better games for lower cost. Even though I dislike early acces models, it would've been more fair on the game if it was early access, cause that is what it feels like.

This game is, to put it simply, addicting. It's extremely fun for reasons you'd never expect, and in a weird way its relaxing. The desert in the evening with your neon sign buzzing, red sky, crickets chirping, and humming of your ice cream freezer is just relaxing. The game really picks up after you level up a few times. Customers start pouring in and you're rushing to fill cars with fuel, check out drinks and snack, change tires, and stock shelves. Its hectic, but don't worry if you get overwhelmed. You can just punch a curious little button with a little spaceship next to it and an alien ship comes, lifts all the cars and customers into space, and you're back to an empty parking lot. These little secrets and random events are my favorite part of the game. Don't pay your loan in time? A biker from the mafia comes and trashes your store. Don't forget to keep an eye out for Dennis, the hateful kid who spray paints...body parts....on your walls while you aren't looking. Get bored? Go drive a mini RC car through the obstacle course, shoot some hoops, or go explore the gator infested sewer beneath your station. Don't be afraid to get creative and give your station a new paint job or decorate. Its highly satisfying, maybe unhealthily satisfying, to see your little patch of nowhere go from a run down, single-pump dump, to a thriving microeconomy. I never thought I'd like a game like this so much, but its absolutely worth the price.

I recommend this game, BUT, be aware that this game does appear to be quite optimized yet. I have a setup that can run ray tracing at 80 fps on dying light 2 but even on medium settings, this game still has some issues. It's a fun game and I am sure the developer will address this in the future, but this is something that you should be aware of prior to purchasing this title.

I'm not sure this game has any right to be as compelling as it is, but the combination of an over-arcing story and goal, combined with a few fast-paced mini-games allows you to take breaks from the repetition that might otherwise get overwhelming. Pushing a broom around the floor is almost zen-like, because you never have to get a dust pan. I don't even really mind when that little brat comes and spray paints my walls, because the painting mini-game is also a welcome break at times from other things. The addition of the RC track and video game console add to the feeling that the developers of this game just want you to be happy. If this would run without issue on my rig while I was watching TV on my second screen, I'm not sure I would play much of anything else for quite a while.

(note there's an addendum in the bottom) 【編注 文末に追記編集あり】

The beginning of the game is pretty interesting. It's fun to grow your own gas station and increase customer satisfaction.
序盤はそこそこ面白いです。自分のガソリンスタンドを大きくして顧客満足度を上げていくのは楽しいです。

The problem comes after level 6 or later. It's the same thing over and over again, and you want to hang your head and I want to know, "I can do this forever and never get a dime? and the feeling of fatigue only increases. There is no growth, no exhilaration, no fun things.
問題はレベル6ぐらいを超えてからです。同じ事の繰り返しで、「これを延々やっても1円も貰えないんだよね？」と疲労感だけが増していきます。成長も爽快感も楽しさもありません。

You have to visually identify and order the missing products. It is not possible to order shortages in bulk.
足りない商品は目視で見分けて発注することになります。不足分一括発注のようなことはできません。

We have a maximum of four employees (I mean two or three people short of a proper shift). I don't know about American labor laws, but this is terrible. 
従業員は最大4名で、適正なシフトには2人か3人足りません。アメリカの労働基準法は知りませんが、これは酷い。

Below average. I don't think I will play again unless there is some major update.
平均以下。何らかの大型アップデートがない限り、もうプレイしないと思います。

[Edit]【追記】
First of off, there was an error in my first review. You can hire up to five employees. I apologize about this.
まず最初のレビューに誤りがありました。従業員は5名まで雇えます。誤記をお詫びします。

Now, in the most recent version update as I write this, a car wash was added, but there're no particular replay-ability features "a crocodile" in the basement (and car wash). But still it just repeats similar things endlessly.
さて、これを書いている直近のバージョンアップで地下のワニ（と戦車）が追加されましたが、含めて特にリプレイアビリティはありません。似たような事を延々繰り返すだけです。


どうせ延々と同じ事を繰り返して楽しみたいなら、例えば、アメリカのある（ニセの）町の警官になって車両事故を処理したり強盗の調査をしたり、ヨーロッパ（あるいは、アメリカ）中を走り回って荷物を届けたり、自動車工場で次々に車を修理しつつ自分の車を買うための貯金をしたり、といった方が楽しいです。
If you're just going to do same thing over and over again, it would be more fun to be, for example, to be a cop in an american (fake) city and deal with car accidents, investigate robberies or aggravated assaults, and/or drive around Europe or North America and delivering packages, and/or save up to bu your car while fixing customer's car after another at the auto shop.

開発陣の労力は認めますが、サムアップにはしません。
I acknowledge the effort of the development team, but I won't give them a thumbs up.

There are other things i could mention that need to be improved but in all honesty, i dont want to put you off from playing the game as, even with these issues, i have had a lot of fun playing it. i just hope the developer gets round to fixing these issues.. which is unlikely as i believe the game is now finished.
As far as simulator games go, this is a really good one. Would highly recommend.

The game is really fun especially if like me you have ADHD and want a game with so many things going on you will literally never be bored even with 5 employees. However it does have a lot of problems, I read a review where someone said it crashes a lot and it does-- a lot. It's always without warning,  fortunately the game auto saves a lot (which might be why it crashes but I'm not a techie so I can't confirm) so when it does shut off literally without warning you can usually get right back to where you were. 

Quality of life wise there's not a lot of diversity in NPCs which is understandable I would rather they fix their optimization first, but it'd be nice to see some more color around there. Both in NPCs and the people you hire, it seems to be the same old guys in rotation every other minute so I'm not sure how 'randomized' it's meant to be but it doesn't seem like it. Also varying ages would make sense? For example, from someone who lived in rural Texas, these are exactly the places teenagers hang out and cause a mess. It would also make use of the dining area you construct for decoration. Also more variety of decorations would be nice, and for the NPCs to stop getting stuck whenever you do add a standing decoration otherwise it's not worth it to decorate at all. 

The uncle quests are alsooo... like it feels like they wanted to put an actual subplot to the game but didn't really carry it through. Like it would at least be cool to break into someones car and find something questionable and do a drop or even have the option to report it. There's also no consequences for literally breaking into someone's car, I wasn't sure if there was a consequence so I did it right in front of a cop and the npc just stood there. 

I hope they continue to add more updates and add more upgrades to the gas station so it gets to Bucees level but I'm not holding my breath. I would recommend it foorrr people who have nothing to do and enjoy a lot of multitasking where you don't have to think too hard or people who like breaking games because glitches abound. Otherwise I don't know if it's worth it with the amount of times it just shuts off without warning. There's no 'mixed review' option so I'll give it a thumbs up bc likely I will continue to play it but it's a wavy thumbs up at best.

You buy a gas station in the middle of the desert. It starts out slowly. You clean up the premises, fix the broken stuff, you customize your store, and while the first few customers drop by you feel proud of what you achieved. It is hot in the sun, and soon it gets more hectic, and you try to paint the walls and sweep the floors between the increasing number of customers. You hire staff. A bit shady people, but you know better than to ask about their past. They turn out to be really helpful, considering their humble pay. You get time to order more gas, and fill up the shelves. You fix more things to be able to provide even more types of services at your gas station. 

It's a great game for the price, and I really hope to see it grow with more features. 

BUT as many others has mentioned already; The only really big con is to get it run without dropping FPS or crashing. Not even on really low graphics settings it is fully stable, I had to restart the game ever so often. But I still really enjoyed the 20 hours I put into it.

It's a fun game for those who like this sort of game; I've had a ball with it, personally.

If you're easily flustered or frustrated, this is definitely not the game for you. If you're not great with time management, it's not the game for you. You often have to juggle which tasks to accomplish first, or ensuring your people are rested enough to be able to cover (some of) the tasks for you.

You have to keep track of your product; I can't tell you how many times in my first hour I'd realize that my stock was out, or that my fuel was too low to finish off that car, causing me to lose my accuracy bonus.

The game encourages both speed, and efficiency, leading to dozens of mini games where you're really only competing against yourself, trying to find that balance of moving quickly, while moving accurately. Go to fast, and risk losing popularity when you accidentally knock an extra item into the basket, or overfuel someone's car. Go to slow, and you risk your work piling up behind you, leaving to play a very frustrating game of catch-up.

But, if you're into this type of game? It's beautifully well done. It's got everything a person can ask for: good graphics, environmental factors, easy ways of correcting glitches, time management, product management, mini games, and more.
